item.title: Report I-2024070109
item.description:
Report I-2024070109

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-29T09:15:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: Greensboro
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While' in transit, a box containing four- 64 fl. oz. cans of material fell over in the trailer resulting in two cans being crushed and Ieaking from closure. This event was caused by improper blocking and bracing and found when the shipment arrived at destination. The material was confined to immediate area. The spill was mitigated from further release. ,

item.title: Report E-2024070639
item.description:
Report E-2024070639

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-29T09:15:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-17
  • City: CHINA GROVE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 17, 2024, one (1) 48-pound box of UN3262 was crushed during unloading and released approximately ten (10) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel removed the damaged bags for waste, then utilized hand tools to collect the released product from the trailer floor. Two (2) 55-gallon drums containing one (1) 48-pound box of corrosive solids, collected product, and any cleanup debris was labeled as non-hazardous and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.title: Report X-2024071786
item.description:
Report X-2024071786

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: This package was brought to the QA cage by the van line manager because of a big wet area on the top and side of the package. Upon inspection, we discovered that one of the four bottles had a loose cap which caused the leak inside the package. We made sure to place this package in a lined hazmat tote and moved this to the hazmat cage.
